results.title: Living reptile: the locomotion of snakes
results.creator_credit: James A. Oliver and New York Zoological Society
results.brief_description: This study of snake locomotion opens by showing the typical four-legged method of locomotion of animals and how it is related to the serpentine motion of the snake. Described in detail are the serpentine motion, employed by all snakes; the caterpillar motion used by some such as the Reticulated Python and the Puff Adder; the side-winding motion used chiefly by heaby-bodied desert snakes, and the hitch-and-hike or concertina method used by some snakes in climbing trees.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James A. Oliver and New York Zoological Society

results.title: Living in memory
results.brief_description: Ray Barrett delivers a potted history of Australia at war, via the exhibits in the Australian War Museum. The film begins in the 1890s and continues through to the Vietnam war mentioning aspects of the Boer War, World War I including Gallipoli, World War II, and the wars in Korea, North Borneo and Malaysia.

results.title: Living arts of Japan
results.brief_description: Visitors to Japan rarely have time or opportunity to examine closely the cultural activities shown in this film: from the measured dignity of the tea ceremony to the delicate brushwork of Japanese paintings, the perfection of lacquer-ware and the vigorous manufacture of wood block prints.

results.title: Live via Early Bird
results.creator_credit: Bill Gibson, Matthew Gordon and Communications Satellite Corporation
results.brief_description: A record of the performance of the first trans-ocean satellite ever to maintain constant, wr-hour communication between two continents while in orbit. Includes an animated review of each phase in the development of the communications system, future possibilities and achievements since the advent of satellites. 48 nations share benefits of the inter-continental satellite system, of which “Early Bird” is the fore-runner. Narrated by Art Balinger.

results.title: Little athletics: hurdling
results.creator_credit: Tony Blane, Australian Little Athletics Union and Shell Company of Australia
results.brief_description: The stages of learning to hurdle are explained and demonstrated. Specific exercises for hurdlers are shown along with more general exercises from which all young athletes could benefit. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Literacy and common sense (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.)
results.brief_description: Don Holdaway demonstrates a lesson in literacy with primary school children. Discusses his teaching methods and how they can be adapted to suit most classroom situations. Author of set text “Foundations of Literacy”.
